TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content:
Could you do a fuel tank to go along with it? A bit like Altiar?

Yes. I plan to do something like the 'service' module with fuel and maybe propillant and set of custom thrusters for maneuver,

but only after i finish with interior stuff )

Many thanks to all . I'm very glad you liked my work.
I agree with GrinchWSLG that the seating arrangement is a bit too cramped. But this is my go-to module now. Really like the design.

new update (0.4) is now available for download.

Added part to the research tree. In to the "Advanced Landing" section.
This capsule looks amazing! And I would totally love you if you made something like the Altair lander!
This lander cabin is fantastic! Here's my newest lander, ready for trial runs.

Alex,

This looks like really wonderful work, and I would love to download it. Could you please upload as a .zip file, instead of or in addition to as a .rar, so that it's accessible to everyone?

Thanks!

Alex,

This looks like really wonderful work, and I would love to download it. Could you please upload as a .zip file, instead of or in addition to as a .rar, so that it's accessible to everyone?

Thanks!

Yes, of course! Check 1st page
Thanks again! I am really looking forward to using this as my lander pod of choice!

This lander cabin is fantastic! Here's my newest lander, ready for trial runs.

What are those side pods near the landing legs?

What are those side pods near the landing legs?

Blinky's Form Tanks: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/bft-form-tank-pack-v1-3/

They aren't updated for 0.2x, so you will have to modify the .cfg files with

PART

{

[leave the rest alone unless you want to take a crack at fitting them into career mode]

}

If you decide to use them, make certain you run a fuel line from them to whatever you have them attached to. In this example the form tanks are part of the descent stage.

Alcor hmmm, i think a candy company is called like that

anyway nice cabin dowloading right away!

Blinky's Form Tanks: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/bft-form-tank-pack-v1-3/

They aren't updated for 0.2x, so you will have to modify the .cfg files with

PART

{

[leave the rest alone unless you want to take a crack at fitting them into career mode]

}

If you decide to use them, make certain you run a fuel line from them to whatever you have them attached to. In this example the form tanks are part of the descent stage.

I want to take over the project because the author left it for dead but I cant find contact info.

Thanks. This is what I've spent my morning on.

Not to rush you, but when might the IVA be finished?
Looks amazing, I'll be giving it a shot tonight. I can't wait to see your finished IVA as well. The thing looks great and I imagine it's going to get better.
Any updates?

I'm think I've found my replacement for the tuna can lander once you release it.

i very much agree with you on this.

That is lovely.

Edited October 28, 2013 by BostLabs

Any updates?

Not yet, But work in progress ))
That looks amazing!

Fabulous work on the interior so far, alexustas.

Do you think you would be able to add one more seat in there?
This lander capsule is now my new favourite toy. Fantastic looking and lends itself to creating fun landers. The exterior texture is really good. Great work!
Due to the shape of the lander, I'm having difficulty placing RCS thrusters on it to get it to translate correctly. Any suggestions from anyone?

Due to the shape of the lander, I'm having difficulty placing RCS thrusters on it to get it to translate correctly. Any suggestions from anyone?

I put circular batteries on the top and bottom and put RCS ports there, it seems to work fine...

Due to the shape of the lander, I'm having difficulty placing RCS thrusters on it to get it to translate correctly. Any suggestions from anyone?

There are some mods out there that have "45 degree" RCS pods - thrust is vectored 45 degrees away from surface horizontal to aid translation when placed on slanted surfaces.

Examples include KSPX and KOSMOS packs.

Just downloaded the pod so I don't know for sure but hope it helps.

I put circular batteries on the top and bottom and put RCS ports there, it seems to work fine...

I forgot my #1rule. Keep it simple. Thanks!
